channel.title: Long time
channel.description:
ok hey guys it's been ahail since i hosted a mopar server and heres whats going on. i got an original 317 server got a client it works, but when i use my ip (not 127.0.0.1) but my 67.215.134.103 Currently back from A 5 month rape Scedule connection it doesn't work! it just saays server down
NOW i port fowarded im using a wireless connection windows 7 64 bit got jdk
Im not that smart when it comes to this subject, please someone respond and help

item.title: Long time
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Hershey Mod Hershey
item.description:
@Mod_Hershey wrote:

[quote=“ytpingas, post:6, topic:381125”]my portfowarding is correct!
my problem is i can’t connect to my server through any ip but 127.0.0.1[/quote]

Well it’s obviously not correct or you would be able to connect with your server ip. Maybe you’re trying to log in with your ip address… which will not work. Make sure your hosting a server ip, i prefer no-ip.com to host, then use the pfportchecker from portforward.com to make sure your portforward worked. You can’t be sure it’s correct unless the portchecker says its open or someone can log in with your server ip… so don’t tell me it’s correct.

[quote=“Zany, post:9, topic:381125”]You’re supposed to connect to your server with 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0

Everyone else but you should connect with your no-ip

Also if someone is on your network they should use the IPv4 address.[/quote]

No, it really doesn’t matter. Hosts can use the server ip they’re hosting and it will make no difference. People say it makes your server slower but its a myth.

Read full topic

item.title: Long time
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Hershey Mod Hershey
item.description:
@Mod_Hershey wrote:

I don’t think you have portforwarded right.

Portforward.com is great in helping in that.

When you portforward, make sure you portforward to the correct ip, and it starts with 192.168.1. By downloading the pfportchecker off of the website, it will tell you which ip to forward to. It will also tell you if your port is open or not. Once it’s open, get a no-ip account if you haven’t done that yet from no-ip.com. After getting the account, go to Hosts/Redirects and make a server ip that you would like people to use to log into your server. Next, download the No-Ip DUC from no-ip.com which hosts the server you added to your Hosts on the website. Once the DUC says your server is online, try logging in.

Read full topic
